intro: Verbascum simplex subsp. hispanicum, commonly known as the Spanish mullein, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and northern Africa. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, fuzzy, gray-green leaves that are often covered in soft hairs. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in late spring to early summer, which are clustered in loose, elongated inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in dry, rocky habitats. This species is valued for its medicinal properties and ornamental appeal in gardens.
